III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications
Section • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member disrespected/belittled Youth A by threatening to
assault Youth A and calling Youth A "little bitch".
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Youth A by phone with the assistance of an
interpreter on 05/01/2025. Youth A proceeded to describe the
incident involving Youth B that was investigated as a part of
special investigation #2025SIC0000382. When Youth A was
asked if anything was said or done to Youth A, Youth A stated
"no".
I interviewed Chief Administrator by telephone on 02/25/2025.
Chief Administrator reported Youth A has been discharged from
the program and Staff 1 was suspended following an incident
involving Youth B and terminated following the completion of an
agency investigation of the incident. These allegations related to
Staff 1's interaction/communication with Youth A are very similar
to the complaint involving Staff 1's interaction/communication with
Youth B that were investigated in special investigation
#2025SIC0000382. The agency was found in noncompliance in
that special investigation as determined by the
behavior/communication of Staff 1.
An attempt to interview Staff 1 was made, but an interview was
not possible/completed due to Staff 1 no longer having phone
service and no longer being employed by the agency.
I interviewed Compliance Staff by phone on 4/14/2025.
Compliance Staff had conducted/completed an agency
investigation involving the interactions/communications between
Staff 1 and Youth B. Compliance Staff stated the outcome of the
agency investigation determined Staff 1 had violated agency
policy in Staff 1's interactions/communication with Youth B.
I interviewed Program Manager by telephone on 04/15/2025.
Program Manager stated he did not observe the incident under
investigation. Program Manager described Youth A and Youth B
as being very active/involved in each other's business due to their
shared language, culture, and circumstances. Program Manager
described it was typical that whatever happened with Youth A or
Youth B, the other would be involved either directly or indirectly.
I interviewed Staff 2, Youth C, Youth D, Youth E, and Youth F
at the agency/facility on 04/30/2025. None of those interviewed
2

reported seeing or hearing Staff 1 confronting/belittling Youth A or
calling Youth A names as reported in the allegation.
Documents Reviewed:
I received and reviewed the agency’s incident investigation report
involving the actions of Staff 1 including an audio recording of an
incident involving Staff 1 and Youth B.
I reviewed special investigation report #2025SIC0000382.
Video Reviewed:
On 04/30/2025 I reviewed with Program Manager agency video of
the time of the alleged incident involving Youth A. A review of the
video did not identify any confrontations between Staff 1 and
Youth A as alleged.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as Youth A denied the
allegations were pertaining to him and only described the incident
that was already investigated involving Staff 1 and Youth B.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
